ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about critical problem solving and trouble shooting skills needed for the science field. We had to write two grant proposals and do an oral presentation, which allowed me to practice public speaking and scientific writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: It really depends on your PI, but the intensive major allows you to explore your research in depth. This helped me to learn about a specific field and science in general. I felt challenged to think about my experiments critically and read more papers.
Weaknesses: I wish there would be more feedback and clarity on the assignments consistently throughout the semester. We didn't receive any feedback on our grant proposals, and we didn't really discuss our project outside of our lab until the end of the semester. The assignments were a bit unclear in what they were looking for.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course because of the depth of research that it allows me to do. I learn a lot because of the amount of effort I put into my experiments and thinking about the project. The presentation also pushed me to present my research in a way I haven't done before. With that said, the intensive major is a lot of effort (>20 hours a week), so it feels like I am in classes or lab the whole entire day.
